summary: Ann Furnald Taylor was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from 1977 to 1978. Her employment is documented through payroll certifications and related records. These documents list her name, position, social security number, annual salary, and pay period earnings. Her payroll records are included in a Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board, which addresses the postponement of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy. She is also mentioned in a JFK Assassination System Identification Form related to background checks conducted on HSCA staff and applicants.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Ann Furnald Taylor's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, as documented in payroll and background check records. These records provide insight into the staffing and administrative operations of the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
